underline.text: wood sere, whatsoeuer thou croppest wil dy.
Juie unbraceth the tree verie sore
Juie, or else tree wil addle no more
haue one thing or other, for all thing
weede hooke, a crotch and a gloue
weed out such weedes, as the
Slack neuer thy weeding, for dearth

mark.name: bracket
mark.text: Where Juie unbraceth the tree verie sore: kil Juie, or else tree wil addle no more.

mark.name: bracket
mark.text: Be sure of haie, and of prouender some, for labouring cattel, til pasture be come. And if ye doo mind, to haue nothing to sterue: haue one thing or other, for all thing to serue.

mark.name: bracket
mark.text: The May weed doth burn, and the thistle doth freat, the fitchis pul downward, both rie and the wheat. The brake and the cockle, be noisome too much: yet like vnto boddle, no weede there is such.

mark.name: bracket
mark.text: In Maie is good sowing, thy buck or thy branke, that black is as pepper, and smelleth so ranke.

mark.name: bracket
mark.text: Where Juie unbraceth the tree verie sore: kil Juie, or else tree wil addle no more.
